law.catch_line: Use of funds -- Lien on building.
law.text: All money received from any bonds issued pursuant to KRS 162.170 shall be used solely for the establishment or erection of the school building and necessary appurtenances, except that the money may be used also to advance the payment of the interest on bonds during the first three (3) years following the date of the bonds. There shall be a statutory mortgage lien upon the school building and appurtenances in favor of the holders of the bonds and coupons.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 562, effective July 13, 1990. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4421-9.
